name: Fluffy Pancakes
cooking_instructions: Combine milk with vinegar in a medium bowl
Set mixture aside for 5 minutes to "sour"
Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a large mixing bowl
Whisk egg and butter into "soured" milk
Pour the flour mixture into the wet ingredients
Whisk until lumps are gone
Head a large skillet over medium heat
Coat skillet with cooking spray
Pour 1/4 cupfuls of batter onto the skillet
Cook until bubbles appear on the surface
Flip with a spatula
Cook until browned on other side

name: Salade Niçoise au Thon
grocery_list: 1 lb. green beans, trimmed, and/or new or baby potatoes, halved if larger
Olives, capers, peperoncini, pickles, or other briny ingredients (for serving)
cooking_instructions: Whisk oil, lemon juice, mustard, honey, pepper, and 1 tsp kosher salt in a medium bowl; set dressing aside
Bring a medium pot of salted water to a boil
Carefull add eggs and cook 7 minutes.
Using a slotted spoon, transfer eggs to a bowl of ice water (keep pot over high heat)
Chill until cold, about 5 minutes.
Peel; set aside.
Meanwhile, add green beans and potatoes to the same pot of boiling water and cook until just tender-- 2-4 minutes for green beans, 10-15 minutes for potatoes
Using a slotted spoon, transfer to bowl of ice water.
Let sit until cold, about 3 minutes.
Transfer to paper towels; pat dry.
To serve, slice eggs in half and arrange on a platter with cooked and raw vegetables and tuna.
Top with pickled-briny ingredient(s).
Sprinkle with sea salt.
Drizzle some reserved dressing over.
Serve with remaining dressing on the side.

name: Butternut Squash Pasta Alfredo
cooking_instructions: Cut butter into small pieces
Cube the butternut squash
Grate the nutmeg
Grate the parmesan
Add cream, butter, squash, and 3/4 cups of water to medium saucepan
Bring to boil
Reduce to simmer
Continue cooking until squash is tender (est. 15 minutes)
Puree until creamy and smooth (3-5 mins.)
Add nutmeg and 1 tsp salt
Bring large pot of saltwater to boil
Add pasta
Cook pasta al dente (see package for directions)
Save 1/2 cup of starchy pasta water
Drain rest of water
Stir pasta and parmesan into squash sauce
Toss until well-coated
Add starchy pasta water, 1 tbsp at a time, as needed, to loosen the sauce
Serve with grated Parmesan and/or nutmeg, if desired

name: Praline Cheesecake
grocery_list: 2 packages Cream Cheese, softened (8 oz., each)
cooking_instructions: Melt butter in a small saucepan
Stir in graham cracker crumbs, 3 tbsp brown sugar, and 1/3 cup of chopped nuts
Pack into an ungreased 9 or 9 1/2-inch springform pan
The crust is now prepared.
Beat cream cheese and 1 1/4 cups of brown sugar until smooth and fluffy
Slowly beat in eggs, one at a time, until blended
Stir in 1 tsp of rum flavoring, 1 tsp vanilla, 1/4 cup of sour cream, and 1/3 cup of chopped nuts
Pour filling into pan, on top of the crust.
Bake at 350 degrees F (175 C) for 55-60 minutes, until set
Remove pan to cake rack
Stir together 1 1/2 cups sour cream, 1/4 cup brown sugar, maple flavoring, and 1/2 tsp rum flavoring
Spread topping over cheesecake
Return to oven and bake for 10 minutes
Loosen sides of cake
Cool until almost room temperature
Let it chill for a few hours before serving

name: Soufflé au Chocolat
grocery_list: Eggs (6, with whites and yolks separated)
Heavy cream or Half n Half (2 tbsp)
cooking_instructions: Preheat over to 350 degrees F
Brush softened butter on the insides of the ramekins
Sprinkle granulated sugar all along the inside of each ramekin
Place a medium, heatproof bowl over a small saucepan with simmering water to create a "makeshift double boiler"
Place the chocolate in the medium bowl and allow it to completely melt
Remove the bowl and set it on the counter to cool
In a large bowl: whisk the egg yolks and 1/3 cup of granulated sugar until thick and pale (use an electric beater if desired)
[Goal: make the batter drop from the whisk in a ribbon-like fashion]
Add the cream/half n half to the bowl of now-slightly-cooled melted chocolate
Whisk until combined
Very slowly stream in the egg yolk mixture into the chocolate, whisking vigorously to create an emulsion
Whisk the egg whites with the cream of tartar in the bowl of a stand-mixer at high speed until foamy
Sprinkle in the remaining sugar and continue to whisk on high speed until softly-curled peaks form
Add 1/3 of the whipped eggs whites to your chocolate batter
Whisk the whites in to lighten up the batter
Add another third of a egg whites, but this time, fold them in using a rubber spatula
Add the remaining egg whites by gently folding them in
Use a cookie/ice cream scooper to gently distribute the chocolate batter into the prepared ramekins, until the batter reaches a little past the inner ridge on the inside, near the top
Place the ramekins on a baking sheet and bake the souffles on the middle rack for approximately 16-17 minutes, until they're puffed up and only slightly wobbly in the center
If they're not set, quickly close the oven and bake for another couple of minutes
To serve, quickly remove the souffles from the oven and place on saucers in front of your guests
Be quick, as the souffles will deflate very rapidly!
